derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in sense 2): from Old French, of Germanic origin

entry.tran: (尤指在有雪或冰时登山者固定在靴底的)冰爪
entry.def: Crampons are metal plates with spikes underneath which mountain climbers fasten to the bottom of their boots, especially when there is snow or ice, in order to make climbing easier.

means.word_mean: 1. a hinged pair of curved iron bars; used to raise heavy objects
2. an iron spike attached to the shoe to prevent slipping on ice when walking or climbing

auth_sentence.content: Nine crampon-footed hikers crunch up the slope of Athabasca Glacier before stopping to catch their vaporous breath.
